intro: Tetraclis clusiifolia, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its upright, branching stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white, which bloom throughout the year in suitable conditions. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers bright, indirect light, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening. Its ornamental value and ease of care have contributed to its widespread cultivation.
